H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H914.def: = action by which part of an entity is separated from the rest, either by detaching it completely it or by creating a kind of barrier (visible or invisible) between the selected part and the rest of the entity

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H1351.def: = action by which humans who have been enslaved regain their freedom, which is normally achieved by paying a price

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H676.def: = one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H8414.def: = location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H2029.def: = process by which someone becomes pregnant

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H1000.def: = an oval or round object coming from the body of a female bird or reptile and containing an ovum which, if fertilized, can develop into a new organism; ≈ appreciated as food

H6848.def: = extremely poisonous snake with the ability to spread the ribs in the neck area so as to form a broad, flat profile; dark brown in color with a yellowish underside (and sometimes yellowish bands); ◄ Desert Cobra (|iWalterinnesia aegyptia|i*) or Egyptian Cobra (|iNaja haje|i*); ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and lurking danger

H707.def: = causative action by which humans produce fabric by weaving

H5908.def: = eight-legged creature that produces silken strands of web in which they catch their prey, mainly flying insects, such as flies, grasshoppers, and the like; ≈ associated with what is temporary and fragile

H6980.def: = woven fabric of fine threads,◄ made by spiders ► to trap insects

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H2116.def: = action by which humans press an object firmly on all sides, typically with the fingers, ► in order to extract liquids from it

H660.def: exact meaning unknown: = type of viper; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with lurking danger

H6980.def: = woven fabric of fine threads,◄ made by spiders ► to trap insects

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H4546.def: = a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H4570.def: = the impression left by a foot or shoe on the ground

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H5054.def: = process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H653.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and lack of wisdom

H5787.def: = state in which a person or animal is unable to see

H1659.def: = to feel about blindly or uncertainly with one's hands ◄ because of one's inability to see ► in order to find one's way

H7023.def: = flat construction, ◄ normally made of stone, ► used as a divider of spaces, or to enclose a space

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H5399.def: = the time of day before the sun comes up and after the sun goes down

H820.def: literally: fat person; hence: = person with health and energy

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H1677.def: = large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H3123.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H7231.def: = process by which people, objects, and events increase in number or frequency

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H5229.def: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H6293.def: = process by which humans or animals unexpectedly meet other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3553.def: = head covering; ◄ made of metal; ► used by soldiers for protection

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H8516.def: exact meaning unknown: = item of clothing

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H5844.def: = causative action by which someone puts an object on top of or in front of something else

H4598.def: = long garment, hanging down to the ankles, ◄ usually made of wool, ► and worn over the {L:tunic<SDBH:כֻּתֹּנֶת>}; it is not clear whether it had sleeves or not, nor whether it was open or closed in the front; ≈ certain attitudes and emotions are often described in terms of such a garment, e.g. "he wore fury like a robe"

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H1578.def: = action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H1576.def: = action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H339.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4628.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H4217.def: literally: the rising  (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4185.def: = process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

28.gl: to put in (someone's) mouth > to give (to someone) to speak
